title: The green tea component (-)-epigallocatechin-3-gallate protects against cytokine-induced epithelial barrier damage in intestinal epithelial cells.
abstract: Green tea consumption is associated with health benefits, which are mainly attributed to its catechins, especially the main catechin (-)-epigallocatechin-3-gallate (EGCG). Among other beneficial effects, EGCG was shown to be protective in inflammatory bowel disease (IBD), a condition associated with barrier dysfunction. To elucidate the mechanisms behind this, the present study analyzed the impact of EGCG on barrier properties and inflammatory cytokine-induced barrier dysfunction in three different intestinal cell models.
